definition: special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex
to invite/to request/to intercept/to solicit/to seek

sentences.english: Specially-invited national jewelry gemologist offers service of free consultation and identification on-site.
sentences.chinese: 特邀国家级珠宝鉴定师现场免费咨询鉴定。

sentences.english: She is guesting on a television panel show.
sentences.chinese: 她作为特邀客人参加电视讨论会。

sentences.english: To this end, he invited scholars from mainland China Cigao.
sentences.chinese: 为此，他特邀大陆学者赐稿。

sentences.english: There was a little cluster of admirers round the guest speaker.
sentences.chinese: 群仰慕者围着那位特邀嘉宾。

sentences.english: Honorary member of the Tianjin Hebei district Committee for Culture and Arts.
sentences.chinese: 天津市河北区文化艺术委员会特邀委员。

sentences.english: The President can't be here today, so I'm going to speak on his behalf.
sentences.chinese: 我代表在座的各位，感谢我们特邀嘉宾的讲话。

sentences.english: He set the chair apart form the others for the special guest.
sentences.chinese: 他把留给特邀佳宾的椅子与其它椅子分开摆放。

sentences.english: Corporate representatives can attend a series of major PR events as special invited guest.
sentences.chinese: 企业代表作为特邀嘉宾出席赛事主要公关活动。

sentences.english: Angra was a featured guest on many mainstream TV shows in Brazil.
sentences.chinese: 安格拉是很多主流电视节目特邀嘉宾在巴西。

definition: specially engaged/employed or commissioned for a special task
to give a lecture/to lecture on
to assist/to help sb do sth/to cooperate in doing sth
to organize/to host (a conference or sports event)
to arrive (esp. of notable person)/to visit (more formal than 光臨|光临[guang1 lin2])
